channel.title: Fiber to the Premises on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in Fiber to the Premises on 0x000216

item.title: Fiber to the Curb and Premises
item.description:
By: John Shepler Copper is quickly disappearing from telecommunications networks, being replaced by fiber optic cabling. While this new cabling might be installed in the same spaces as the old copper, the outdated copper lines are often left behind. You might be thinking, “But I still use copper connections!” And it’s true that many devices use copper wiring. So where exactly is all this fiber? Mostly Fiber Outside, Mostly Copper Inside..
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/fiber-to-the-curb-and-premises/

item.title: Broadband Ethernet Internet Services
item.description:
Ethernet point-to-point and LAN services have gained popularity among businesses, often replacing T1 lines and outdated Frame Relay networks. Ethernet is also a great way to connect to MPLS VPN networks and the internet. Carrier Ethernet began as a business-oriented Metropolitan Area Network (MAN) service known as Metro Ethernet, often used by companies to connect multiple locations within a specific geographic region. E-Line point-to-point services like EPL and EVPL provide comparable or superior connectivity to T1 lines, even when multiple T1 lines are used...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/broadband-ethernet-internet-services/
